item.title: UHV Project
item.description:
The ultra-high vacuum (UHV) system is important to study the solid-gas interface, where many catalytic process happens, e.g. CO oxidation at Platinum surface.

My main project at University of Duisburg-Essen is building an UHV system, which integrates LEED/AES, TPD and SFG.

The UHV system has already been built up and worked well. The picture of the setup is shown above. We recently get the sum-frequency generation spectroscopy work for the UHV system.

item.title: Extract KHz femtosecond laser-driven photocurrent with lock-in amplifier
item.description: In this project, we aim to extract the photocurrent generated by the electrochemical cell when the KHz femtosecond laser shines on the work electrode. In this case we can study the charge transfer process across the solid-liquid interface.

item.title: Two photon pump - photovoltage/photocurrent probe
item.description: We utilize two photon pump - photovoltage/photocurrent probe scheme to study the ultrafast charge transfer dynamics across the metal-liquid interface.
